column3: Concept ACK (in the absence of a nicer-and-reliable-yet-quick alternative).
Concept ACK. I can't imagine we'd care about the performance difference of -O3 vs -O2 for one object file inside Qt...

> I suspect @fanquake will hate the fact that we're echoing into a generated file. This would be much cleaner if done at the qmake level, but I'm not sure how to do that.\n\nThanks for the explainer and potential fix. I'm going to propose an alternative using a macOS scoped patch, which should be suiteable to merge into master and backport.
As I've asked on IRC tooâ€”O3 has the nasty habit of exposing compiler issues, why not build the whole thing with O2?\n\nConcept ACK anyhow if this solves the non-determinism issue.

Looks like O2 is already the default for linux (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/816132e6eb23c06287c1e820cc0990d2317c2f10/contrib/gitian-descriptors/gitian-linux.yml#L46), but it isn't set for macos

@laanwj Depends sets a default of -O2, but some things (qt obviously, boost, recently secp256k1 iirc) override it. We've never really tried fighting that, afaik.\n\nI just wanted to demonstrate the minimal determinism fix here. If you'd prefer to switch the whole thing to -O2, I'd be happy to whip that up instead.
Thanks for the great detective work, and initial patch. However I'm going to close this in favour of #20447.
